Subjective: Tired for 2 months; possibly superficial sleep; no clear cause; able to work and exercise but with difficulty; more muscle and back pain than usual; no snoring or respiratory issues; no heart issues; normal appetite and weight; normal stools and urination; no family history of rheumatism; patient request: concerned about possible rheumatism
Objective: BP 110/60, HR 40-60; lungs clear; back exam: mild tenderness in lower spine, no pelvic pain, no abnormalities in neck or shoulders; abdomen: lively peristalsis, no pain on palpation
Assessment: Fatigue and muscle pain, cause unclear; no evidence of rheumatoid arthritis; possible anemia or thyroid disorder
Plan: Check blood for anemia, thyroid function, and inflammation
Patient to call for phone appointment after blood test results
Safety net: call if symptoms worsen or new symptoms develop
